timeline.bodyText: hi smarthi, thanks for opening the PR, I am wondering if we really need these methods? or will them be used somewhere later?
timeline.author: leesf

replies.bodyText:
yes these can be used as replacement for Guava-Strings in SparkMain.java.
Also see #1159 (comment) for the need to write test cases.
The new methods will potentially be used in the bigger PR# 1159.
replies.author: smarthi

timeline.bodyText: IMO, here we can compare it with the joined literal string? It is not necessary to use split it. WDYT?
timeline.author: yanghua

+package org.apache.hudi.common.util;
+
+import org.junit.Assert;
+import org.junit.Test;
+
+public class TestStringUtils {
+
+  @Test
+  public void testStringJoinWithDelim() {
+    String[] strings = {"This", "is", "not a", "test"};
+    String joinedString = StringUtils.joinUsingDelim("-", strings);
+    Assert.assertEquals(strings.length, (joinedString.split("-")).length);

timeline.bodyText:
Can we use static import here for all these static assertion methods to remove Assert.
And can we write a testStringJoin method to test the null and non-null scene(rather than write a method for a special scene)?
timeline.author: yanghua

replies.bodyText: I am not a fan of static imports - hence I avoid them - but will do to keep that consistent with rest of project
replies.author: smarthi

timeline.bodyText: We can also add a test case for non-null and non-empty string here.
timeline.author: yanghua

timeline.bodyText: This line is repeated and would be removed, you would merge it @smarthi after the change.
timeline.author: leesf
